entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 8:54AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER FOR THE REMAINDER OF THIS WEEK... Conditions remain dry across Southeast Alaska and temperatures will continue to rise to the upper 70s and lower 80s across much of the region over the next few days. Fine fuels are dry and there is a risk of camp fires getting out of control. Winds will remain light, which is a mitigating circumstance working in our favor.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 31 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Runoff has begun, with significant rises on area streams... Area streams have risen the last day or two from significant precipitation that occurred last weekend. This included two to four inches of precipitation in the foothills, and one to three feet of heavy wet snowfall in the higher elevations of the mountains. The newer snow may be ripe to quickly melt off with warmer temperatures
